items.content:
Senior Strategic Account Executive

Various
US, Canada or LATAM
$400,000 USD
Company: Crossover
Full Time

Overview

We’re running an Online Hiring Event this Saturday to hire Senior Strategic Account Executives ($400K/yr).

Online Hiring Events are live forums designed to enable you to understand the role and requirements through an interactive Q&A session followed by a self-directed testing process. The testing takes between 3-5 hours to complete. It’s worth taking the time to finish all the tests because we evaluate every single complete application to find the top talent.

This event will include all testing required to apply for the role. Upon grading the tests, and if you advance, we will set up an interview with the hiring manager.

You will be working for a fast-growing private equity-backed enterprise software company that acquires other enterprise software companies. In our enterprise software space, customer success is the heart of the business – and annual sales are how these customers show us how they value our products.

You will understand their needs and convince them to grow with our various IT and business-related services. Structuring deals as recurring revenue opportunities and using our portfolio of different sales methods and products will be the key element of your daily work. In this position, you will be managing large accounts within F250+ businesses.

To be effective in this role – you must be a great communicator, a coachable strong learner and be extremely metrics-oriented. You will be asked to sell new solutions across many of our ESW Capital companies – so you will need to be able to learn each of these solutions in detail from business case to deployment model.

You will have a span of influence within a small number of accounts and contribute a significant strategy to the goal of enhancing the relationships at the C-Suite and recurring revenue growth. This is what will determine your success – to master the ability to pivot and strategize in a fast-paced and challenging environment to meet the needs of your clients and generating revenue.

Apply today to expand your global network and embrace a new challenge – all while working remote and having the flexibility to balance your work-life.

Candidate Requirements:
  • 15+ years of enterprise software sales experience selling to large, complex corporations that are F250 or larger companies.
  • You have demonstrated success in selling to and developing partnerships with clients in these accounts.
  • You have a stellar record of achievement with exceptional referrals from your clientbase and peers.
  • Your focus has been to go deep and wide within a small number of key accounts, (ie 10 accounts or less) and developing strategies and relationships.
  • Extensive experience selling subscription or term limited licence deals of greater than $500k+ of annual recurring revenue.
  • Your software quota has been $5M incremental ARR or greater in your current or previous roles.
  • C-Level client engagement -Built relationships and partnerships with clients at Executive and CXO levels in large enterprise and global organizations that are minimum a F250 company.
  • Experience in managing clientele relations and expectations through acquisitions.
  • Ability to demonstrate strategic sales planning and execution to win. Demonstrated success exceeding new business quota.
  • Strong ability to present credible business value with high acumen of business knowledge and ability to align and engage with the right stakeholders.
  • Impeccable organizational skills & highly coachable.
  • A passion for the high-growth environment.
  • Having had experience as both an individual contributor and managing an enterprise sales team.
  • A degree from a highly regarded institution.
  • English Native/Advanced.
  • Bilingual in English + German would be an asset.
  • Travel 50%+

    • Join our community of remote professionals!



    To apply for this job please visit the URL below.

    Please reference Jobspresso in your job application, so that remote companies know where their best candidates are coming from

    https://seniorstrategicaccountexecutive.eventbrite.com?aff=funAleJobspresso →

items.title: Senior Sales Executive
items.content:
Senior Sales Executive

Sales
US or Canada
$120,000 USD yearly + $80,000 USD bonus
Company: Crossover
Full Time

Overview

We’re running an Online Hiring Event this Saturday to hire Senior Sales Executives ($120K USD/Year Base + $80K USD/Year Commission Opportunity).

Online Hiring Events are live forums designed to enable you to understand the role and requirements through an interactive Q&A session followed by a self-directed testing process. The testing takes between 3-5 hours to complete. It’s worth taking the time to finish all the tests because we evaluate every single complete application to find the top talent.

This event will include all testing required to apply for the role. Upon grading the tests, and if you advance, we will set up an interview with the hiring manager.

In our enterprise software space, customer success is the heart of our business – and net new customer additions are how these customers show us how they value our products as well as how we organically grow.

As the Senior Sales Executive, you are the hunter and closer who will manage the entire sales process from initial outreach, through contract negotiation and to closure. This includes creating sales opportunities by diligently prospecting to new companies and effectively following up on Marketing generated sales leads.

To be effective in this role – you must have the ability to hunt and grow a book of business and are familiar with the enterprise computing space.

You must be a great communicator, competitive, a coachable strong learner and be metrics-oriented. You will be asked to sell new products, across many of our ESW Capital companies – so you will need to be able to learn each of these products in detail landing each of their unique differentiation points and value adds.

You will also be coached by expert sales leadership, with decades of enterprise selling experience, who will continually teach you new innovative methods to communicate with customers and close more deals.

Candidate Requirements:
  • 5+ years of enterprise software sales experience as a hunter Demonstrated success exceeding quota, proven track record of closing $600K + annually in net new software licenses
  • 2+ years of experience selling B2B software with Annual Recurring Revenue of $100k+
  • Experience in prospecting, qualifying through the sales stages and closing deals
  • Cold calling experience.
  • Curious about industry changes and trends.
  • Managed an active pipeline of 20+ sales opportunities at any given time Strong adoption of Challenger Sales Methodology a plus
  • Strong organizational skills & highly coachable
  • A passion for the fast-pace/high-growth environment
  • Location – US or Canada
  • Native/Advanced English Fluency

items.content:
Enrollment Director, Inside Educational Sales at StudyPoint

Remote

Who We Are

StudyPoint is a national leader in the private tutoring industry. We are actively seeking enthusiastic, driven individuals to grow our team.

We’re in the business of helping kids, and we’re exceptionally good at it. Our students see dramatic gains in their academic and standardized test results, and our employees enjoy the rewards of growing a mission driven, values based, and entrepreneurial company. We’ve been selected to the Inc. 5000 list of the fastest growing companies in America eight times, and were the list’s #1 fastest growing tutoring company. We’ve also been awarded the Boston Business Journal Pacesetters Award three times, which recognizes the fastest growing companies in Massachusetts. We are a two-time winner of the 50 Most Engaged Workplaces award along with Zappos, Disney, and others. We are privately owned and profitable.

Join a rising star in the education world and a leader in the for-profit education community!

Position Description

StudyPoint provides a unique service to families across the country: one-on-one, individualized tutoring with access to a proven curriculum and a national network of support.  Members of our Enrollment Team work as an inside sales consultant, helping families determine which program and tutor is right for them, all while relaying the value of our services.  We are looking for highly motivated individuals excited to sell programs that meet families’ needs while exceeding their expectations.

Responsibilities

  • Grow the business by meeting and exceeding monthly sales goals, achieved by enrolling families in StudyPoint’s academic and test preparation programs.
  • Field calls nationally from families looking to enroll students in our programs.
  • Employ a consultative phone sales approach to determine the individual needs of families and students.
  • Match tutors with students based on personality, interests, and skill level across 20 markets throughout the US.
  • Follow up with families who express interest in our programs using email, outbound phone calls, and other methods of communication.
  • Achieve data-driven goals in the metrics of outbound calls, total talk time, inbound calls, and conversion rates.
  • Collaborate with team members responsible for servicing programs and hiring tutors to maximize potential of enrolling more families.

Qualifications

  • Excellent interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to work with many types of people.
  • Excitement around closing the deal and helping families achieve the best possible solution for their child.
  • Ability to multitask and handle a high volume of calls and emails.
  • Careful attention to detail and ability to quickly process verbal and written information.
  • Willingness to work in a constantly changing environment and learn new systems.
  • Willingness to do 20-50 outbound calls and 3-4 hours of phone time per day
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office and experience working with a CRM database.
  • Excitement to take on increasing responsibility and grow within the company.
  • Experience working in a small, entrepreneurial environment a plus.
  • Previous sales experience a plus.
  • Work schedule of 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, M – F and some Saturdays during January, February, July & August. Willingness to put in extra hours where needed during busiest seasons (winter & summer).
  • Bachelor’s degree required.  Master’s degree a plus.
  • Access to a dedicated home office, including high-speed internet connection. We provide all of the technology you need.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary with optional performance-based commission plans, paid monthly. Starting range $60,000+, with six-figure potential.
  • Generous leave policy, including paid time off and sick days.
  • One paid day a year to volunteer with an organization of your choice.
  • Health coverage and dental option.
  • 401k option.
  • Work from home.
Apply for job

0.0%–0.05%

Job Description

Position Overview
MemSQL is looking for an accomplished sales professional to join our Enterprise Sales Team. In this role you will be responsible for closing new business and expanding existing business with large enterprise customers in the tri-state region. This is an incredible opportunity to join an established, fast-growing startup in the enterprise software industry, where you will have the opportunity to over-achieve, earning uncapped commission and accelerators.

Enterprise Account Executives at MemSQL are accomplished sales leaders who are passionate about evangelizing the industry’s most disruptive technologies. You’re excited to exercise your modern data infrastructure expertise and communicate solution value to enterprise accounts. You also possess an in-depth understanding of the market landscape, have the ability to partner closely with sales engineers and inside sales reps, and can thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

Role and Responsibilities
Develop and execute territory account plans to achieve (ideally exceed) quota
Lead multiple customer sales cycles and effectively close new business (hunter mentality with the ability to sign new logos)
Manage and grow large, strategic enterprise accounts
Effectively partner with Sales Engineering, Inside Sales, and Field Marketing
Quickly learn our software products and be able to clearly communicate the value proposition
Develop strong relationships with key decision makers, influencers, and partners within your territory
Travel within your assigned territory

Required Skills and Experience
Proven track record of successfully selling enterprise software solutions and increasing revenue through new customer acquisition
Solution selling of a disruptive technology in the data infrastructure space
Firm understanding of the modern data infrastructure such as the open source community and the various enterprise software (business intelligence, analytics, ETL, cloud infrastructure, etc.) products
Demonstrated ability to sell to CXO or line of business, successfully emphasizing business value versus product
Strong ability to connect with customers to understand their individual business needs
B.S. degree or equivalent in a related field
Understanding of OLTP and OLAP architectures is a plus

items.content:
Job description
Role: Business Development Director
Location: Founders Factory Office, Kensington, London


Who we are

Alegra is a multi-platform content publishing and e-commerce SaaS company. It enables brands to upload their content and products once and then seamlessly publishes that content and e-commerce functionality across all digital platforms (responsive web, tablet, mobile apps), dynamically and seamlessly. With built-in Magento automation and content monetization modules, brands can be trading online within hours.

Alegra has partnered with Guardian Media Group and Founder’s Factory has now to launch into the UK and further European markets. The company originated in Turkey and has grown exponentially, it already boasts leading clients such as P&G, L’Oreal, Fox TV, eBay, Naspers, Bauhaus and MailGroup and many others. We are executing on our vision of becoming the leading digital e-commerce platform.


About the role
We are looking for an experienced enterprise business development professional to join and drive a further significant increase in new client acquisition and lead our sales strategy. Our sales process is typically collaborative, includes identifying and qualifying companies and individuals who would likely be interested in the platform and then consulting with them to implement pilots and then full implementations. The buyers are typically a combination of tech and/or marketing leaders, often at c-level positions in online retail or publishing organizations of typically over 30 employees.

Reporting to the CEO, the successful candidate should bring a combination of solution-selling mastery in the SaaS/E-Commerce space, as well as being able to map market’s, find and understand buyer’s needs and get a buzz out of closing deals!


Responsibilities include:
- Building and managing a pipeline of UK and EU leads and opportunities through to confirmed implementations.
- Leading sales and business development activities to achieve growth targets.
- Developing creative solutions to clients' problems using our platform
- Scoping solutions, acting as a consultant
- Growing our client base and associated revenues by establishing new client partnerships in the online retail and publishing verticals.
- Personally leading the presentation of the business to C and manager level executives at every stage of the partnership process.
- Partnering closely with the client/delivery team to ensure successful overall outcomes for clients.
- Follow up customer success and strengthen relations with Clients over project time.


Experience:
- Managing the sales process through the complete sales cycle from lead generation and initial prospect contact through to successful closing and follow up sales activities.
- Building sales activity planning and strategy.
- Highly desirable: Experience selling a similar product (e.g. Magento / Demandware) to the retail industries.
- Preparing high-quality presentations and proposals for submission to clients in support of new business pitches and opportunities.
- Delivering timely and accurate revenue forecasting and management information, and reporting on a regular basis using sales management tools such as Hubspot.
- Demonstrable track record in over-achieving demanding sales quotas on a quarterly and an annual basis.
- Experience selling complex solutions to senior executives across mid to large-size organizations and your proven ability to network, gain appointments, generate and grow a pipeline, negotiate, and close deals to meet and exceed quota.
- Preferably having experience in a SAAS company or E-Commerce Solution Agency

What we can offer you
- Be one of our first joiners to UK office and grow your own team
- Work out of Founder’s Factory offices in Kensington High Street, with free fruit and snacks, lunches on Thursdays and Fridays, exclusive speaker events and high-quality networking with other young, high growth ambitious companies.
- Rich equity options, Competitive salary( 60£-75£) and uncapped commission scheme
- Join a growing and exciting company, with a proven product and track record, and be one of the early joiners as we expand into Europe.
- Ownership and responsibility to make things happen and make a real difference, working with some of the world’s great companies in the UK and beyond.

How to apply
Please complete the application by pressing Apply button.

items.content:
Engagement Manager (M/F) // mvpfactory

Company: mvpfactory

Tags:
  • Account Management
  • Project Management
  • Engagement manager

    • MVP Factory reinvents software development for companies and engineers. We deliver the best software on earth, combining elite engineers, designers and product managers with artificial intelligence on our platform. We enable companies of all sizes to efficiently design, test, build and scale top technology products.

    You will be trusted full responsibility for the end-to-end delivery of projects for a wide set of clients (from start-up to enterprise) from various industries and an even wider selection of problems to crack. You will lead multiple project teams and report directly to MVPF’s Managing Directors.

    Together with our sales team you will close new clients by understanding their business and tech needs, translating them into software requirements, quoting projects and assembling internal project teams. After this initial phase you will oversee the delivery of the project, directly managing a product manager, who takes over day-to-day product and project management. You will supervise him/her driving the product development process and keeping the project on track. With the client you are expected to build a deep relationship that drives revenue: Conduct proactive meetings to develop trusted advisor status, build loyalty, improve business. You are responsible for project reporting and project profitability from signed contract to project end. After the project has ended you will disseminate project learnings using our internal knowledge base.

    REQUIREMENTS

    • You have 3+ years of either Product Management, B2B account management or business development experience
    • You have demonstrated the ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization (including executive and C-level) in delivering client-focused solutions based on customer needs
    • You are well structured and have a proven ability to manage multiple projects or accounts at the same time
    • You have a good understanding of software development processes and projects
    • You managed teams previously (having managed outsourced tech/product teams is a plus)
    • You are entrepreneurial, with equally strong business and technology skills
    • You have a genuine interest in up to date technologies and industry trends
    • You possess excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (German is a plus)

    BENEFITS

    We offer (besides the standard stuff):

    • Competitive Salary
    • Bonus scheme based on company performance
    • The job will enable you to build a network of companies and people all over the world and share knowledge with the best entrepreneurs in the industry
    • You’ll be a part of our lively team and MVPF community. We’re passionate about what we do, have fun while doing it and work with the best people in their fields
    • We embrace remote work and allow our employees to work remotely whenever possible. Employees will still come in at least a few days a week for team collaboration and company events
    • 5th floor light infused penthouse office in the heart of Berlin with rooftop terrace and chill-out area
    • Top-notch technology equipment – whatever you need to do your job the best way possible
    • “Take as you need” vacation policy + occasional pop-up offices to facilitate remote work
    • Regular team events – we celebrate our successes together
    Apply for this position

items.title: SDE Small Team Manager
items.content:
SDE Small Team Manager


Redox


Redox is an engineering-first company, building the future of healthcare information exchange. We are looking for an experienced Tech Lead with strong development skills to join our small and fast-paced team. In this position, you'll be creating the communication platform used by the entire healthcare software developer community. Specifically, you will help lead a small team of developers by working with them to set goals, holding the team accountable, providing updates to the larger engineering team, and bringing learnings from other small teams back to your team.

This role offers a great blend of hands on engineering along with team leadership and mentoring. Plus, we are a remote based company, so you can live anywhere in the US!

At Redox, we have a culture of trust, transparency and tireless personal growth.

Please Apply If You Are...


* Passionate about solving complex problems and doing good

* Enthusiastic about building high functioning, autonomous teams based on trust vs control

* Intellectually curious with a genuine desire to learn

* Excited about working in a constantly changing ecosystem

* More interested in team productivity than individual productivity

* A good listener who shows respect to your colleagues

* A believer in asking for forgiveness, not permission

* Comfortable with uncertainty and turning complex problems into actionable plans




Responsibilities


* Defining technology goals for a small team of developers

* Holding the team accountable to those goals

* Working closely with the product owner to effectively plan projects for the team

* Providing updates to the larger engineering team

* Advocating for your team’s needs with the larger engineering team

* Bringing learnings from other teams back to your team to implement

* Shipping elegant code - yep, you still get to do development

* Collaborate with and support your fellow team members




Preferred Experience:


* Experience with a wide array of technologies

* Management or coaching experience, especially in a software engineering environment

* Previous tech lead experience, or senior level engineer

* Healthcare Experience/Interest

* Experience managing technical projects end-to-end

* Effective project management and communication skills

* Cloud computing in one of: AWS, GCP, Azure, Cloudstack, OpenStack, etc




It is not expected that any single candidate would have expertise across all of the areas outlined above. Please apply even if you are not sure you meet all these criteria. If you are interested in the role and think it could be a fit, we'd like to hear from you.

Please note, due to the data we deal with, currently we are only able to hire software engineers that live in the United States.

BENEFITS


* Live anywhere. Work anywhere. We are a remote-first company. We care about your impact, not your location.

* Annual productivity stipend. We empower you to buy what you need to make yourself more productive, whether that's a standing desk, extra monitors, a new suit, or personal coaching.

* Open vacation policy. We believe that doing your best work means that you regularly take time off to recharge.

* Health and dental insurance.

* Life and disability insurance.


See more jobs at Redox

Business Development Director at Kaul Sales Partners

Remote

Business Development Director

This flexible contractor position includes making “SmartCalls” to targeted prospects. Our ideal candidate has a strong background in prospecting for leads selling software or consulting solutions.

Kaul Sales Partners represent marketing companies, management consultants, software developers, IT service firms and SaaS software companies, as well as other unique service  companies.

We provide our clients with a suite of services unique in our industry that includes prospecting, pipeline management and closing services. We will fully integrate you into our digital marketing approach to sales prospecting and lead generation.

items.content:
Backend Developer (for our ROIBACK business)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: B2B, Information Technology, Travel & Tourism
Company size: 5k-10k people
Company type: Private
Company: The Hotelbeds Group | Palma, Spain

Remote details

Office Location: Palma, Spain. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

javascript
python
sql
html5
linux

Job description

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES.


How can you help us?

We are seeking for top programmers and software architects to be part of our technology team.

As a software developer:


• As part of our booking engine team, implementing user stories with high business value using good techniques and practices.
• Helping the Product Ower in clarifying, prioritizing and estimating the user stories.
• Designing technical solutions and developing clear, testesable and efficient code, performing peer reviews with your collegueas.
• Ensuring continuous integration and build is in place.
• Collaborating with architects and other developers to produce just enough design and just enough technical documentation.
• Writing technical user stories for refactoring the existing code or implementing new technical features.

As a software architect:


• Doing some up front architecture envisioning to get started the developments in the right direction, collaboratively working with the team.
• Facilitating the architectural modeling and evolution efforts of our technological platform.
• Understanding of the business domain and communicating the architecture to developers and to other project stakeholders.
• Practising code review, pair programming and other agile techniques to improve the development team programming skills.
• Transitioning architectural skills to other team members

What can we offer you?


• To participate in very challenging projects with the top hotel chains from Europe, Asia and America, from the idea to the delivery.
• To work in a Company that invests (really invests) in technology.
• To be part of an Agile culture to obtain the best results in software development and to become a high-performance team, in a really happy environment.
• Work together with extremely passionate programmers, and being part of a top programmer community.
• To be part of a team-making decisions, to determine the technical roadmap of our platforms.
• To lead both business and technical projects from end-to-end.
• To live in the best city of the World

(http://www.thesundaytimes.co.uk/sto/style/homes_and_gardens/best_places/article1533629.ece)

CANDIDATE PROFILE.

• It is a must to hold a University degree in Engineering or Computing Sciences, or having completed at least 80%.
•  If you know Python or Go ... excellent! But what we are really looking for is a top programmer who loves technology and software development, and ready to learn any programming language that could be required.
• You have to feel comfortable working with databases (SQL and NoSQL), web programming (HTML5, CSS3, Javascript) and Linux environments.
• Good programming best-practices, such continuous integration, unit testing generation, code repositories, log management, code comments and documentation ...
• You will need to meet with the business to understand the needs and to translate them into code.
• You will be part of an agile team, so, what is really important in Roiback is the team success, not the individual success.
• It is not a must to have a lot of experience. For us, what is really important is the potential and attitude you have to become a great programmer

Apply now

About The Hotelbeds Group

Roiback.com

About us

We specialise in the development and management of online projects for hotel chains and independent hotels. We not only have a knack for all things digital, but we also have a knack for people. We know that the closer we are to you, the better and more adapted solutions we'll provide to your business. We have over 15 years experience in the industry, which has allowed us to develop a team of professionals who exceed in their fields. WHAT WE DO: We work with our partners to get to the nitty gritty of their business. This allows us to design custom-made solutions that deliver tangible results and provide a real answer to market demand. Our passion allows us to never stop improving our service and product offering, day in, day out. • Integrated Marketing Online Management. We help you build your brand differentiation in today’s crowded digital space. We have a flair for everything online and a real passion for the hospitality industry. Our method is quite simple: we first analyse your needs and then define action plans that make sense for you. We bring you a fresh approach to help you get the most out of your marketing spend, finding cost-effective ways to drive more traffic, and more bookings, to your website. • Web Design & Development. items.content:
Account Executive

Headquarters: Boston, MA
URL: https://jobs.lever.co/helpscout/2bae0aaf-a067-4819-b7b8-416f4506e1b5?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=WeWorkRemotely

At Help Scout, the sales team serves as a trusted advisor for prospects and customers -- listening to their needs, clearly explaining what’s possible, and leading training/onboarding efforts to make sure everyone is successful for the long term. Quite simply, you’ll have the opportunity to impact small businesses in a big way on a daily basis.

About the role

  • You’ll partner with customers through the entire buying process, from initial evaluation to close, and through onboarding of the entire team. You’ll be the primary point of contact through the first year renewal.
  • You’ll team with marketing to ensure inbound campaigns are well coordinated as you follow up to qualify and close those opportunities.
  • In most cases you’ll be partnering with SMBs between 10-250 people. On a monthly basis you’ll have the opportunity to close several new deals and get them on track with the product.
  • The companies you work with will be qualified and passed to you based on the number of expected Users. They will mostly be trial signups, webinar attendees, or inbound leads we’ve talked with to get a high-level understanding of their needs. You’ll also work with existing customers on high-value upgrade and expansion opportunities.
  • Most of your time will be spent working with stakeholders over email and on the phone, and doing demos. There’s a reason we call you a trusted advisor -- this is less about the hard sell and more about having the product knowledge, passion and people skills to let the product sell itself.
  • Based on what works, you’ll experiment with, measure and document strategies that help us increase sales effectiveness. You’ll be a critical part of helping us enhance our sales playbook.
  • You’ll be proactively reporting on learnings and valuable feedback to the product team so that we can improve the product and prioritize the right projects.

About you

  • You have 2+ years of successful selling to SMBs, and have experience working on deals similar in size and volume to the ones you’d be working on at Help Scout.
  • You are in sales because you love helping people win. It energizes you to work alongside people to improve their business.
  • You are naturally curious and have a history of learning new things quickly. This is especially important in a remote company like Help Scout, as you won’t always have people nearby that you can talk to and learn from.
  • You excel at managing yourself like a successful business -- highly organized, setting and achieving goals with regularity, creating a great customer experience, and making your teammates better.
  • You have experience tracking all of your sales activity and reports with Salesforce.
  • As the primary point of contact and a trusted advisor, you’re happy to wear several hats: sales, support, customer success. Over the course of a customer’s first year, you may be point person on any one of them, mobilizing your teammates for support.
  • Above all, you’re an entrepreneur and are excited by the prospect of building your business and hitting your quarterly and annual goals.

Benefits

  • Competitive Salary - We pay at or above market salary in most cases and evaluate a lot of research to make sure everyone is paid well. The formula we use to calculate all salaries is public to employees and is improved upon regularly.
  • Health and dental insurance - We cover you and your family's health/dental insurance 100%. If you are based in the US, we'll cover you on our Aetna policy. If you're based outside the US, we offer a healthcare stipend.
  • Long-term/Short-term Disability Insurance & Life Insurance - We cover 100% of the premiums for LT/ST Disability insurance and base Life Insurance. You also have the option to purchase supplementary life insurance through our provider. (currently US only)
  • Flexible vacation - Take time off when you need it, we trust you.
  • Paid parental leave, including adoption and foster care - 12 weeks for primary caretaker and 4 weeks for secondary caretaker.
  • 401k with 1% match - via Betterment for Business (currently US only)
  • Personal Development stipend - Up to $1,800 per year to improve your craft
  • Great tools - Each employee will be provided with a Mac laptop and 27'' display (or equivalent equipment of choice).
  • Home Office Stipend - You'll also receive $1,000 to spend on outfitting your home office, as well as up to $350 a month to rent a co-working space if you like.
  • Company Retreats - Twice a year, we get together to meet and work in person, covered by Help Scout.
  • Complete transparency - Everyone has full access to business metrics and financial information about the company.

To apply: Please submit an application on our website (link above). We can't wait to hear from you :)

items.content:
The Organisation

ImpactEd is an award-winning social enterprise that supportsschools in understanding the impact of their programmes on pupil outcomes.

Schools invest huge amounts of time, money andenergy in different initiatives to support their pupils – from in-schooltutoring to enrichment programmes to mentoring projects. But far too often, itis extremely challenging for them to assess the impact of what they do.ImpactEd aims to address this evaluation deficit, improving outcomes and lifechances for children by helping schools to better prioritise those programmesthat will make the biggest difference.

We do this through a digital platform that makesmonitoring and evaluation easy for schools. As we launch the full version ofthe ImpactEd platform, we are recruiting for a School Partnerships Manager whowill be key to leading our growing number of school partnerships. You'd bejoining a dynamic education startup combining technology, educationresearch and collaborative working with schools to make a difference to thelives of tens of thousands of pupils over the coming years.

The Opportunity

ImpactEd has been driven by schooldemand, and as School Partnerships Manager, you will be the first point ofcontact for our expanding network. Our partners include national school groupssuch as Challenge Partners and United Learning, andyou will be vital to ensuring that schools have the best possible experiencesof working with us. Ultimately, you will help translate teachers' use ofImpactEd into meaningful decisions that improve outcomes for pupils at nationalscale.

You'll be joining an early-stage organisation andbenefit from significant opportunities for growth, including the possibility ofbuilding a team as the organisation continues to scale. As such, you will needto have a few years' professional experience. The strongest candidates willhave experience of working in or with schools, or programme and platformdelivery, as well as an interest in research and evaluation, and a passion forhelping schools to work with us successfully.

About You

You are likely to have experience in some or all ofthe following:

  • Working with or in schools
  • Managing partnerships, particularly inbuilding engagement with programmes or digital products, and contributingtowards consistently high retention rates.
  • Presenting to senior stakeholders,including delivering training and on-boarding sessions.
  • Research and evaluation, andquantitative analysis, especially in education.
  • Business development, includingsupporting sales.

More important than specific experience will be:

  • Highly-developed communication skills.You will be an effective and engaging presenter, but also skilled at listeningand understanding problems, focused on developing relationships as welldelivering training on a product.
  • Attention to user problems and passionfor fixing them. We want high-quality customer service to be at the core ofwhat we do, and you should share that vision.
  • Capacity and enthusiasm for learning.You will need to pick up lots of responsibilities quickly, and these willdevelop over time - this should excite you.

Why Us?

  • Rapidly growing social enterprise witha social mission at its heart.
  • Agile and flexible working - flexiblehours, work from home options, responsive management, high levels of feedbackand professional development opportunities.
  • Opportunities for significant growthand career progression.
  • Join a team with a track record ofsuccess in both technology and education, including the founders of The Brilliant Club and Super Being Labs.

The application deadline is Monday 1stOctober at midday. First-roundinterviews will be held in London on the 4th and 8th October, and second-roundon the 11th October. Please note that exceptional candidates may beinvited to interview ahead of this time, so early applications are stronglyencouraged.

For further details: See the full job packat http://tiny.cc/SPM.

To apply: Submit a CV and one page covering letter through the button below or to owen.carter@impacted.org.uk. Owen can also be contacted for aninformal conversation about the role.

items.content:
Sales Executive


Signeasy

About SignEasy

Our mission is to help people and businesses improve productivity by signing documents electronically. We have a passionate team that works in Dallas, Bangalore and Mexico City and we love people with an enthusiasm for productivity hacking and travel.

SignEasy eliminates the need to print, scan, or fax paperwork and is the fastest way to sign or request signatures from your phone, tablet and computer. With 5 million downloads and 100,000 customers across 180 countries, SignEasy has been featured among the Best Business Apps on Apple App Store and Google Play Store in 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017.

Here’s a peek into our team and culture at SignEasy:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d-7f-fCvDMg

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zMh3oToSXZU

Role overview

We need someone who can convert leads into sales opportunities. Someone who can talk to customers, ask questions to identify their needs, and then propose solutions that will turn them into paying customers.

This role requires enthusiasm, high energy, and strong verbal and written communication. You will be the first person that a customer talks to, so personality and likeability are a must. If you're a monotone robotic speaker on the phone, this role is not for you. If you can get a grandma excited about electronic signatures, we want to talk to you :)

Responsibilities

* Contact and qualify prospects to set appointments and learn about the needs of customers* Identify decision makers in organizations across key industries/functions and build a prospect list* Own and execute outreach to targeted accounts and prospect lists in a personalized manner* Nurture and qualify interested prospects by setting up demos* Monitor users acquired through free trials for potential sales interaction* Share insights from existing sales funnel and evaluate the performance of lead sources* Be available for phone calls and meetings with customers and team members in other time zones* We are hiring for three time zones - US/LATAM, UK/EU, Asia - You will be expected to make your calls during the hours of your region

Requirements

* 1-3 years of experience in sales development / AE role, preferably in a tech/SaaS company* Ability to achieve goals in an automated sales environment with accurate lead management in a CRM* Team player, with a strong self-starter attitude* Desire and drive to always be learning* Strong written and verbal communication skills* Confident, positive, energetic, and professional attitude* BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience**Assessment**We believe that the only metric that matters is results. Your performance will be evaluated based on how many customers you are able to qualify, the quality of the information you are able to get from them, the quality of your communication with team members, and how many deals you had an impact on. We judge you based on the results you deliver and the learnings you can share with the rest of our team**Perks*** Fully remote job* Travel opportunities - SignEasy is headquartered in the US, with an office in Dallas, product development team in India, and sales team in Mexico City. Travel to all of our offices and interact with a global diversified team and grow together with us* Opportunities to attend conferences and seminars**Team Dynamics and Culture*** You will work with a small team of 3-5 other people across sales and marketing functions* Interact with Marketing and Product teams and learn an end-to-end understanding of this business* Opportunities for promotion based on performance - we don't believe in arbitrarily keeping you in the same position for a fixed amount of time. If you perform, we promote and give more responsibilityOur culture is driven by respect, transparency, collaboration and direct feedback. We have no room in our team for disrespect, office politics or discrimination of any kind. We're obsessed with communicating with our users as well as within the team. We love lean, iterative improvements, and success is measured by the value we create for our customers and the company.

See more jobs at Signeasy

items.title: Sales Manager (SaaS)
items.content:
Sales Manager (saas)


Filestage

**About Us**

At [Filestage](https://filestage.io/) we believe that broken workflows poison teams with miscommunication, friction, and frustration. Our mission is to fuel creative teams with a rock-solid workflow. With our software, we empower people to produce great results together and build healthy and meaningful relationships at work.
Over 500 companies (and growing!) all over the world like Lufthansa, Canadian Tire or Rabobank benefit from happier and more productive employees with Filestage. We work hard to build great things together—and make time to celebrate our accomplishments.

**Your mission**

* **You own the sales cycle.** You take ownership for SMB to enterprise leads and nurture them throughout the entire sales cycle. With every closing, you have a direct impact on the growth of our company.
* **You optimize our sales funnel.** You analyze and optimize our sales funnel, our sales performance and our sales techniques. You improve and further automate our sales processes from the first lead contact until the closing. Your goal is increase our MRR and push sales at Filestage to the next level.
* **You create value for our new customers.** You develop a deep understanding for the needs of our customers. You present a product solution that makes their workplace more productive and happier.

**You’re good at**

* **You have a 3+ years proven SaaS sales experience.** You’ve had prior success in SaaS sales and want to take it to the next level.
* **You love connecting with people.**You know the definition of empathy without checking Wikipedia and put it into practice daily.
* **You take ownership.** You are filled with passion to take responsibility and to make things happen. You are an energetic self-starter who loves to build and scale sales in a startup.
* **You are fluent in English** and have fantastic written and verbal communication skills. French is a plus.
* **You’re cut out for remote working (in case you choose to work remotely).** You are highly self-motivated and are comfortable working independently. Ideally, you have already worked remotely in the past.
* **You are a team player.** You understand that we can only be successful as a team. Like everyone else in our great team, you are fair, honest and respectful - and you are ready to have a lot of fun.

**This is what you get**

* **You have the freedom to work wherever you want.**Come work with us at our office in Stuttgart (Germany) or work remotely.
* **You have a steep learning curve** by working hands-on together with highly talented minds.
* **A fair compensation.** You get a fair base salary based on your skills and the option to participate on the long term success if you’re a high performer.
* **Your opinion matters and your work is valued.** You have the chance to make a difference and grow our sales team together with our CEO.
* **You’re tired of useless meetings and slow decision making?** We have flat hierarchies, no bullshit meetings and we move fast.
* **You work with top-notch technologies and lean processes.** We use Slack, Asana, Hangouts -and of course Filestage- to communicate efficiently.

See more jobs at Filestage

Visit Filestage's website

items.content:
*Business Development & Research Assistant*

We have an IOS MVP that’s 90% complete and a Pitch Deck ready to send your way outlining everything about Reeltime.

*What we’re looking for:*

We’re looking for a Business Development & Research Assistant that can help us analyse the market and speak to our target audience in order for us to continue building the perfect product.

*Who we want you to connect with:*

Vloggers, Influencer’s, Travel bloggers, Video Producers or anyone thats’s active in creating video or using Instagram stories.This is a great opportunity to get involved in an early stage startup and help steer us in the perfect direction for the future.

We assure you this is something you want to be a part of. See our summary below:

*Why?*

Video is King.

There are more content creators than ever before. We want to give them the right tools to make high quality, captivating and fun content, fast. As our smart phone’s video capture and processing capabilities continuously improve, our apps and the experiences they offer must improve with them.

So we’re building and launching our MVP.

*What is it?*

REELTIME is an incredibly simple live video editing app that’s had an overwhelmingly positive response to our initial Demo and Pitch Deck. Everyone loves it.

@RachelleHay _“I would find an app like that super helpful!"_

Siobhan Mcauley _“And alexouthwaite that app sounds amazing especially for us”_

@joshahdashian _“I love the concept and as soon as it’s out I’m downloading it!”_

@thebiggsisland _“I agree that would be awesome”_

@LiamWalker _“That would be handy for me as someone who rarely does videos and would like to make it a little more attractive!”_

@Vivien Bass _“Oh yes!! Ive been dreaming of it!!”_

***************************************************

The UXUI has been fully designed and it’s well and truly validated with some incredible features and roadmap to follow.

The IOS MVP version is 90% complete and we’re also looking into android development too.

*APPLICANT REQUIREMENTS:*

- Highly familiar with Instagram and social media.

- Confident & professional communication skills.

- Intuitive and self motivated.

- Design skills a bonus.

- Be seriously passionate about building things!

***************************************************

We also have a very strong network of people who will be able to test and market this GLOBALLY across social media. Our Advisory board is also fantastic and Investment talks are taking place.

You’d be coming on board as an someone that’s able to work remotely and in your own time so it’s therefore unpaid but should give great experience and be good fun.Depending on experience/commitment we can discuss an equity deal.

Please say Hi and tell us a little bit about yourself along with your experience.

Let us know if you have any questions. We’d love to hear from you!

Demo and Pitch Deck available on request.

Based in Shoreditch, East London.

Leo

Keeping records of prospects and contacts in our CRM
Once leads are qualified handing them over to the CEO to convert

Entrepreneurial mindset is important

items.content:
Junior Sales Development Representative
Ideally based in London

Our mission is to empower people and companies to use data to do transformative things. We provide technology and services that enables our users to collect the data that they want, use that data to understand each of one of their customer’s complete user journeys, and transform their business.

Snowplow has grown significantly over the last 12 months and we are now looking for our second Sales Development Representative to help us achieve even bigger things!

The Opportunity:
Our sales function is newly formed so, as the second Sales Development Representative there is enormous scope for a talented individual to progress quickly and have real impact on how this team is formed over the next few years. Starting with qualifying inbound leads, the role will see someone go on to work closely with our marketing function to create innovative outbound sales material.

Within 3-9 months (depending on individual progression, there’s no pressure to be a sales expert within a few weeks), you’ll also learn how to carry out demos of our product and how to guide a customer through the entire sales journey, from initial call to customer.

The environment you’ll be working in:
Our culture is as unique as our customers. Over half of our employees work remotely from all over the world so we have fostered an environment based on trust, communication and transparency. You won’t find micro-management here and everyone takes ownership of their work. Collaboration is at the core of everything we do – we work together and learn from each other.

What you’ll be doing:
Managing inbound sales queries in Salesforce
Qualifying inbound leads and carrying out initial calls with potential customers to assess how/if our product could add real value to their business
Working closely with our marketing team to start producing some outbound lead generation
Gaining deep knowledge of our product offering with a view to being able to take over some demo calls
Achieving (and hopefully exceeding) monthly and quarterly sales targets
Effectively managing your workload & prioritising tasks

What you bring to the team:
Min 1 year experience in a sales role (preferably within a data analytics/SaaS environment)
A conscientious, caring & team-oriented attitude
Drive, enthusiasm and creativity
Passion for technology and adding value to businesses through data
Fantastic communication skills, both written and verbal
Confident, calm and collected nature
Self-motivated and always looking for opportunities to learn & improve

What you’ll get in return:
A competitive package based on experience, including share options
25 days of holiday a year (plus bank holidays)
Freedom to work wherever suits you best
Two fantastic company Away-Weeks in a different European city each year (next one is Milan in May 2018!)
Work alongside a supportive and talented team
Grow and develop in a fast-moving, collaborative organisation
Enjoy fun events in and around London organised by our Cultural Work Committee
Learn to code or improve your existing skills with our Software Development Guild
Convenient location in central London (Shoreditch)
Continuous supply of Pact coffee
Regular events with the team

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=8, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=2, frontend=0}
items.content:
Contact us remotejobr->gmail.com

Account Executive - North America

Headquarters: Sydney, Australia
URL: http://jobs.qwilr.com/o/account-executive-north-america

We're looking for an experienced Account Executive based out of the North America to join our growing global sales team. 

At Qwilr, our sales team serves as a trusted advisor for prospects and customers - listening to their needs, clearly explaining what Qwilr is (and isn't), and leading our initial training and onboarding efforts to make sure everyone is successful for the long term. 

Note: While you can be located anywhere in North America, you will need to be comfortable working Pacific coast hours so that you can overlap with the team in Sydney. 

To see this page as a beautiful Qwilr, and get more details, here.

Requirements

You have 2+ years of successful selling to SMBs, and have experience working on deals similar in size (1k to 10k ACV) and volume to the ones you’d be working on at Qwilr. 

You have worked for an excellent SaaS Sales company. This could be a startup or a big player like Salesforce or HubSpot, but we're looking for someone who has experienced an excellent sales culture. 

You are excellent at inbound - but you're not afraid of occasional outbound. We get thousands of inbound leads per month - but there are times that outbound makes sense. 

You know your way around a modern CRM. You will need this for your day-to-day, as well as for helping our clients as we embed deeply into CRMs like Salesforce & HubSpot. 

You are in sales because you love helping people win. It energises you to work alongside people to improve their business. 

You are naturally curious and have a history of learning new things quickly. At Qwilr, our product is always evolving, as is our market. Things will change - you need to be comfortable adapting to that change. 

You excel at managing yourself like a successful business. You are highly organised, you set and achieve goals with regularity, you create a great customer experience, and you make your teammates better. 

Above all, you’re an entrepreneur and are excited by the prospect of building your business and hitting your quarterly and annual goals. 

The Simple Benefits 

Competitive Salary & Comp - with uncapped commissions. 
Equity - Everyone at Qwilr owns a meaningful stake in our success. 
Paid parental leave - 12 weeks for primary caretaker and 4 weeks for secondary caretaker. 
Company Retreats - Every year we get together to meet and work in person in an amazing location somewhere in the Pacific (typically near a beach). 
Complete transparency - Everyone has access to business metrics and financial information about the company. 
Further Education support - We'll cover all courses below $1000 and split the ones above with you 50/50. We'll happily buy you any business books you'd like to read - even if they're outside of your role. 

The Real Benefits

Impact

Every member of Qwilr is actively encouraged to input and contribute to the direction of the product and the company. We actually have a formal process around The Big Questions at Qwilr called “Group Think”. Ideas can come from any quarter and shape our whole trajectory. 

Work with smart people who care about what they do

We’ve got that list of impressive backgrounds we can reel off (Google, Microsoft, Campaign Monitor, McKinsey, Harvard etc) - but what you really need to know is this: Qwilr is fierce about finding the best people and providing them an environment to flourish. That means we’ve got a team of really smart people, who really care about, and take pride, in what they do. 

We have a high bar of excellence 

Our first principle as a company is “Undeniable Bestness”. We believe in winning our race by being the best, not throughs hacks, bandaids and shortcuts. This means we have a high bar of excellence at the company. We go back to the drawing board when things aren't right, because we care deeply about the quality of what we produce.



Our Process - What To Expect.


  • Tell Us Something About Yourself: Together with your CV, send in a Qwilr Page telling us who you are, why you think you would be great for the role, and what your favourite sale was. 
  • Chat with our Talent & Culture Lead: If your Qwilr Page resonates with us, we'll set up a get-to-know-you chat with Elisa. 
  • Chat with a Founder: If you look like a good fit you'll chat with Mark, the Founder who leads our Sales team. 
  • Pitch us Qwilr:  We find that there is no better way to find out if someone will be good for the job than to have them do the job in a simulated environment. We do this in some capacity for all hires across Qwilr. This task will mirror what it’s like working with our prospects in a sales call. 
  • Chat with the sales team: As things progress you’ll chat with two or three of our Sales & Success team. This will be an opportunity for you to get to know us at a human level, and for us to get to know you. 


Why Qwilr?


Qwilr makes it easy for people to express themselves using the web. 

We have thousands of customers from over 50 countries, we have an excellent product, our team is doubling in size every year (and our revenue is growing even faster), we are backed by some of the best SaaS investors on the planet, and we are growing like crazy. 

Now is the time to join.

To apply: To Apply head to: http://jobs.qwilr.com/o/account-executive-north-america And submit a CV as well as a Qwilr Page telling us A) Who you are and why you think you would be great for this role, and B) What your favourite / best sale was. We want to know the details, why it mattered to you, how you did a great job and anything else that you think is relevant / impressive.

  • Ability to travel to onsite meetings at least twice a week in Silver Spring, MD

Aha Media is a fast-pacedatmosphere. If these align with your values, you should apply:

   and expect them todeliver their very best—every time.

·  Meaningful work, meaningful life: We put inthe time we need to get the job done

   communicators whosay the things we mean and mean the things we say.

·  Stay curious longer: Weapproach every challenge with a fresh perspective and 
   explore new approachesand solutions.

·  Always be learning: We focuson continuous learning and self-improvement.

To apply: If you are interested, please submit:• Resume• Cover letter (include where you found the job posting, the city & state you live in, your educational background and # of years accounting, finance or related experience)• Please include a P.S. with the number 6 in your cover letter and send your application to careers@ahamediagroup.com

items.title: Sales Development Representative
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
ABOUT US

Here at Akkroo, we’re on a mission to help businesses think differently about exhibiting and the way they capture and process leads at B2B trade shows and events.

We’re at the forefront of a new, emerging category that bridges the big gap between exhibiting at events and the organisation’s existing Sales and Marketing processes.

We’re based in London, UK, however have a large and growing customer base in the US and in line with our recent Series A funding are now hiring for Sales Development Representatives in key US locations, including Chicago.

Sales Development Representatives play an incredibly important role in Akkroo, helping us to proactively qualify buying interest, understand size and shape of potential accounts and line them up for further conversations and demos with the Account Executive team.

ABOUT THE ROLE 

  • This role is all about helping us to generate well qualified sales leads in the US
  • The role will involve a mixture of:
    • visiting local B2B trade shows, exhibitions and events, mostly at McCormick Place Exhibition Centre, to open conversations with great-fit customers
    • prospecting into target accounts, utilizing a modern suite of outbound sales tools, campaigns and social outreach
    • handling inbound enquiries received via the Akkroo.com website outside of UK working hours to qualify those leads and transition into the sales pipeline
  • You’ll be part of our larger, UK-based Sales team with a focus on identifying and qualifying great-fit customers which are then passed over to our Account Executive team for demo and closing
  • You’ll also work alongside our Marketing team to identify sectors, organizations and events to target
  • This is a part time, remote and flexible contract position - the exact number of hours each week may vary, but we’re anticipating around 30 hours. 

ABOUT YOU

  • You have previous B2B sales experience, either as an Account Executive or SDR role, ideally within a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) organization
  • You love speaking to new people and are just as comfortable face-to-face as you are on the phone, via email or live chat through our website
  • You’re willing and able to travel to events (occasionally at weekends) to meet new prospects
  • As this is a remote role, you’re able to do great work independently and love the challenge of solving problems, proactively tackling challenges and when you don’t know something, you embrace the chance to grow and get better
  • You’re setup to work remotely, with a suitable working environment and able to invoice us on a bi-weekly basis for your hours worked as a contractor

WHAT WE’RE OFFERING

  • This is a fantastic opportunity to join a successful European scale-up as one of our early teammates on the ground in the US
  • We’re paying competitive salary, based on an hourly rate for a fixed number of hours. On top of this, you’ll receive a commission scheme based on generating Sales Qualified Leads
  • You’ll be provided with all the tools you need to successfully do the job, including a MacBook and access to a suite of software that we use, including Slack, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, SalesLoft and Hubspot CRM

items.title: Senior Offline Media Planer/Buyer (m/f/x)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Are you a curious innovator? A passionate problem solver? Born digital? And maybe a little wild at heart? If so, read on.

We’re DCMN – the growth marketing partner for digital businesses and startups. Our holistic, data-driven approach combines technology with expert knowledge to grow the market leaders of tomorrow. Our vision is bold: we want everyone in the world to use one of our client’s services. If you have the drive to get us there, let’s talk.


Join our ambitious, supportive and international team, and you’ll work on the following:
- Develop growth solutions for digital brands together with your client team, always with our mission in mind: to grow the market leaders of tomorrow
- Take full responsibility for assigned clients and their marketing campaigns (focus on performance-driven TV campaigns)
- Challenge client briefs and internal teams to ensure we deliver stuff that sets us apart
- Interpretation of campaign results and ability to explain them to clients and discuss the results with them on an advanced level
- Planning, buying, controlling and on-going optimisation of international marketing campaigns (with a strong focus on TV campaigns)
- Prepare comprehensible campaign reports, based on our own TV attribution tool and third-party tools
- Build good, yield-rich and long-term relationships with our (international) customers
- Advise digital commerce companies about opportunities to scale their business with data-driven and intelligent marketing campaigns
- Effectively communicate and promote our vision and philosophy to potential new clients and stakeholders
- Live the startup vibe, act as an entrepreneur, have a hands-on approach and proactively identify opportunities that go beyond your daily account managing tasks to help grow our business in the UK market


Of course we’ll need you to bring along a few things, including:
- At least 4 years working experience in digital marketing and/or DRTV
- 3-5 years of experience in planning, buying, controlling and on-going optimisation of TV campaigns in the UK (preferably also internationally)
- Good network of contacts in the UK offline/TV landscape
- First experience with Sky Advanced products, OTT campaigns and video advertising are beneficial
- Proficiency with tools such as Techedge/IMD - CARIA, etc.
- Knowledge of other offline channels (radio, OOH, etc.)
- Not afraid of working with numbers and Excel, plus strong analytical skills
- Previous experience within a startup and/or in the field of marketing for digital brands is a big plus
- Efficient and result-oriented working style
- Fluent in English (written & spoken)


And here’s what you’ll get in return for working with us:
- An awesome WeWork office space in the heart of Shoreditch full of radically supportive colleagues
- Support for your personal and professional growth, whether this means regular massage sessions and pilates classes or an overseas conference trip
- Flexibility to manage your own hours and work from home whenever you need
- A multicultural work environment, plus the chance to visit our international offices and apply for our exchange program. One year placement in New York, anyone?
- No hierarchies, freedom and full responsibility from day one. We believe top-down hierarchies just limit our progress – so we’ve created a whole new way of working

Can’t wait to get started? Then we’d love to hear from you. Please send us your CV along with any relevant documents and your earliest possible starting date. And don’t hesitate to reach out if you have any questions!

items.title: Account Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Company Overview:

DeepCrawl is a pioneering cloud-based, enterprise website crawler. We’re an emerging start-up with an ambitious growth strategy and an established client base comprised of many of the world’s largest brands and digital agencies. DeepCrawl is on a mission to deliver crucial insights to teams managing large-scale, complex websites, and to become the tool that powers brands’ reporting, and supports all marketers in extracting actionable data from web properties.

Utilising some of the very latest technology, including NoSQL databases, AngularJS, Elasticsearch and AWS, the DeepCrawl technology team are on the cutting edge of SaaS design and implementation. Our Marketing, Sales and Service functions are examples of a classic SaaS model with class leading customer acquisition costs, service delivery, and customer success.

Working in partnership with major corporates and digital agencies, our client base consists mainly of digitally savvy and connected individuals who work hard and have fun. We are looking for entrepreneurial team players who match our culture of self-starters, revelling in taking responsibility and delivering excellence in an environment where they are encouraged to be innovative and self-reliant.

Key Responsibilities:

We're seeking an ambitious Enterprise Account Executive to join our EMEA Enterprise Sales Team. The Enterprise AE is a proactive, entrepreneurial and enthusiastic hustler who delivers engaging, tailored and enjoyable experiences to prospective clients throughout their buying journey. This is a great challenge to join a growing enterprise sales function, where you can build and manage key relationships, both internally and externally, while securing new business to significantly contribute to the company's growth and success.

- Source new opportunities for DeepCrawl through Outbound efforts
- Understand customer challenges to develop and present bespoke solutions
- Navigate a set of, often complex, organisational champions and decision makers to win buy-in for subscribing to DeepCrawl
- Deliver SaaS demos that are engaging and highlight how DeepCrawl can solve important client challenges/problems
- Drive revenue in the EMEA region by closing Enterprise deals
- Collaborate across Customer Success, Marketing and Product teams
- Serve as the customer’s voice when passing on market knowledge and product feedback to the Product & Dev teams

Key Criteria:

Your personality is as important as your skills and experience in determining whether or not you’ll be a success at DeepCrawl. As an Enterprise Account Executive, you will represent the company both in and out of the office (at events & meetups) and are expected to cultivate and develop strong relationships with prospective clients, so exceptional people skills are a must. Success in this position requires a consultative sales approach, ability to solve business challenges and and the ability to consultatively drive the sales process forward to meet & exceed monthly targets.

- At least 3-5 years’ experience in opening & closing business
- Experience in a SaaS company would be beneficial but not essential
- Strong listening and questioning skills with an ability to understand new people quickly
- Positive approach with a genuine drive for personal and team success
- A history of exceeding expectations and working hard to achieve goals
- Energetic, enthusiastic and thrives in a startup/entrepreneurial environment
- A fast learner who is able to understand complex or technical challenges
- Passionate about digital marketing and technology
- Ability to generate innovative ideas that solve complex problems
- Understanding of SEO (advantageous)

Why work for DeepCrawl??

- We're an innovative and fast growing tech start-up
- Raised our series A investment from a prominent venture capitalist
- An international business, with clients all over the world and offices across London, New York and Poland
- Flexible working from home & remote working policy
- Potential to travel to other offices
- Annual personal training budget
- Company trips
- Monthly office drinks & lunches

items.title: Sales Development Representative
items.content:
Overview of the role

DeepCrawl is currently growing at an exceptional rate, and in order to drive this growth we’re growing the sales development team in the London & New York offices. The team will be responsible for reaching out to potential clients, generating leads and pipelining sales meetings for the Enterprise Accounts team. This opportunity sits in the London office.

Key Responsibilities

- Take the lead in creating demand for DeepCrawl’s award winning technology by phone and email outreach, with the goal of setting meetings for our Enterprise Account Executive team
- Research potential clients, their companies and search marketing strategies in order to provide insight to the sales team
- Cold call, prospect, nurture and qualify new leads, building a healthy pipeline of prospective clients
- Collaborate with the Sales and Marketing teams on initiatives that drive demand generation and revenue growth
- Develop and deliver optimal work flows and best practices in order to make demand generation as efficient and scalable as possible

Key Criteria

- A passionate self-starter who has the ability to deliver in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
- A confident communicator who can quickly build a rapport with potential clients
- A positive, determined and resilient approach to selling
- A high degree of self-motivation and ambition
- A genuine interest in the technology space
- A naturally curious mind with a passion for keeping up with the latest trends and developments within the SEO and digital marketing industry

Why work for DeepCrawl??

- We're an innovative and fast growing start-up
- An international business, with clients all over the world and offices across London, New York and Poland
- Potential travel to other offices
- Annual personal training budget
- Company trips
- Monthly office drinks & lunches

items.title: Social Media Manager
items.content:
Exciting new startup in the process of raising equity funding is looking to bring on a Social Media Manager.

The company is bringing a popular existing game into the 21st century by integrating cryptocurrency and blockchain technology. The role will be part time initially, with the opportunity to be brought on full time. Remote working accepted for the initial stage.

Ideally the candidate will be as follows:
- Has knowledge/interest in the cryptocurrency/blockchain space
- Has the will to play a key role in the success of the company
- Is a self-starter and can work without major supervision
- Experienced in managing different social media channels
- Experienced in coming up with innovative ideas for campaigns
- Experienced in creating visuals for said social media campaigns (or at least the ideas for said ideas)

On offer is:
- The chance to be part of an exciting company
- The opportunity to work alongside smart, like minded people
- The opportunity to share ideas as a key member of the team
- The opportunity to eventually build your own team

Compensation is negotiable. Good short and long term earning opportunities.

Please apply to this role mentioning previous experience, your knowledge of crypto, why you think you would be the best person for the role and one thing of your choice which may convince us you are the right person.

items.title: Global Business Developer USA
items.content:
Who is the MOST inspiring person you know? What have they ACHIEVED that you really admire? Wouldn’t it be great if they would share their success secrets with YOU?

The obvious answer - YES - prompted us to embark on our mission, aiming to improve 10 million lives by 2022. By creating marketing campaigns, launching digital products or coaching our clients, PASSION.IO gives inspiring people the platform they deserve to share their message with the world and impact lives.

We are an international team with the majority of our customers in the US. We’ve grown from nothing to multi-million dollar business in under 2 years… because when you focus on impact, income will follow. We work together to not only make this company successful, but to transform our clients, our customers and ourselves into our best versions.

As we say, Do it with Passion, or not at all.

Do you think you’re the right fit?

We are looking for an inspiring, engaged and motivated new member for our business development team that proactively drives our US expansion and manages projects related to that.

You gained work experiences in high-paced environments and have the vision to change the future of learning.

Your mission will be to build and execute on various projects to market the Passion.io learning experience to millions of people anytime, anywhere. We work with social media celebrities with millions of followers. Working on key projects around them will be a relevant part of the job. Hence, past experience with project management, sales and strong execution skills would be beneficial. You will work in a cross-functional team to deliver high quality, outstanding work.

*What you'll be working on*
# You will analyze different verticals in the US, close partnerships, organize video productions, and build up deep functional expertise
# You work on product launches while consistently sounding out the market to help refine the products while monitoring and optimizing key performance indicators (KPIs)
# You will have ideas for further developing the products and business model, have a clear idea about the offers, and how they transform the market
# You will successfully drive projects through the lifecycle from conception to launch
# Define, structure, develop processes and tools, and show measurable results
# You will work on key projects in marketing, such as CRM, mobile, loyalty, and others to deliver high quality traffic, optimize conversion rates, and improve retention
# You will support implementing the marketing strategy and its roadmap across offers
# You will keep a close eye on the market, competition and use your research to continuously improve marketing activities
# You will identify and convert leads to active clients, including larger clients and strategic partnerships
# You will identify opportunities to further improve the sales processes, streamline operations and share best practices across markets

*What you'll bring to the team*
# Outstanding degree at a top university (likely: MBA, Wi-Ing or similar)
# Desirable: Prolonged stay abroad (> 6 months)
# You have exceptional analytic skills and a strong attention to detail as well as a hands-on mentality
# Preferably gained 2 years professional experience in high-performance environments (strategy consulting, banking, start-up, or similar)
# Proven track record of professional achievements
# Project management: You planned, implemented and controlled major projects, in particular extensive analytical, sales, and marketing work
# Preferably: supported internationalization, set up new business verticals

*What we offer you*
# Steep learning curve: Expect the steepest learning curve you have ever experienced - we are building a playground at passion.io to become the best version of ourselves. Meet and work with successful people worldwide to learn their success secrets.
# Value-based company: Be part of an open, honest, creative, and results-driven environment where your opinion is highly valued. We want to change the globe for the better by providing value to others.
# High-growth environment: You will be part of a strongly growing company with the opportunity to develop into a key contributor with incomparable responsibilities.
# Personal and professional development: You will tackle projects across departments and thereby gain a top-notch tool box to succeed in tackling bigger and bigger challenges.
# Autonomy / entrepreneurial work-style: You will only be measured by the results you produce and are in the driver’s seat, with full flexibility.
# Berlin: You will join our friendly and international team located in the heart of Berlin Mitte.

items.title: Global Business Developer Trainee
